message.content:
To solve the task, we need to identify the line item in the given income statement that represents the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life, which is typically labeled as "Depreciation."

From the provided income statement data, we can observe the relevant information:

```
| Account                | Amount      | Date        |
| ---                    | ---         | ---         |
| Main Business Revenue  | 547392.30   | 2024-02-05  |
| Total Revenue          | 547392.30   | 2024-02-05  |
| Cost of Goods Sold     | 353220.00   | 2024-02-05  |
| Total Cost             | 353220.00   | 2024-02-05  |
| Gross Profit           | 194172.30   | 2024-02-05  |
| Administrative Expenses | 11762.87    | 2024-02-05  |
| Selling Expenses       | 14714.68    | 2024-02-05  |
| Depreciation           | 91488.35    | 2024-02-05  |
| Financial Expenses      | 2220.62     | 2024-02-05  |
| Total Expenses         | 120186.52   | 2024-02-05  |
| Interest Income        | 9881.70     | 2024-02-05  |
| Profit Before Tax      | 83867.48    | 2024-02-05  |
| Tax Expense            | 27369.63    | 2024-02-05  |
| Net Profit             | 56497.85    | 2024-02-05  |
```

We can see that "Depreciation" is indeed listed as one of the accounts, with a corresponding amount of `91488.35`.

Thus, the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life is indicated by the "Depreciation" line item, which has a value of `91488.35`.

Now, formatting this into the required json format:

```json
{"solution": {'value': '91488.35'} }
```
